question: World Health Organisation has launched global strategy to eradicate which disease by 2050?
explanation:
The World Health Organization (WHO) has recently launched a global strategy to eradicate cervical cancer by 2050.
The strategy aims to reduce over 40% of new cases and 5 million related deaths by 2050 through vaccination, screening and treatment. The annual number of new cases of cervical cancer is expected to increase from 5.7 lakh to 7 lakhs between 2018 and 2030, without additional action.
